intro: Racosperma extensum, commonly known as the broad-leaved acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with numerous small, oval leaflets. It produces yellow flowers in dense, globular clusters, which are attractive to pollinators. Racosperma extensum is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient component of native vegetation.
